definition: story or deed that captures the imagination and is spread far and wide
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]

sentences.english: It's a time thing for the elephants.
Huangpu River permanent fountain depicts a group of moving stories of this period.
sentences.chinese: 黄浦江边一组永久性喷泉再现了这段动人的佳话。

sentences.english: There are one story about written contacts between Zhangchao and Zhurenhuo.
sentences.chinese: 张潮与褚人获有一段文字交往佳话。

sentences.english: Gallantry like that no longer exists.
sentences.chinese: 那样的风流佳话不再存在了。

sentences.english: Most successful marketing tales begin and end with a well-plumbed niche.
sentences.chinese: 许多成功的营销佳话都源自定位精良的利基。

sentences.english: The Chinese revolution, become a much-told story.
sentences.chinese: 成为中国革命史上的一段佳话。

sentences.english: This might be one of the best sports stories of the year.
sentences.chinese: 这也许是今年体育界的一段佳话了。

sentences.english: It was a rare example of a happy, faithful Hollywood marriage.
sentences.chinese: 这缔造了一段好莱坞罕见的愉快，忠实的婚姻佳话。

sentences.english: Tanabata ancient, enduring a period of building a much-told tale.
sentences.chinese: 古老的七夕情人节，缔造了一段不朽的佳话。

definition: gifted scholar, beautiful lady (idiom)/pair of ideal lovers
poetic occasion/elegant situation/in literature, the cue for a poem
married couple very much in love/deep conjugal love
lit. you can sing or you can cry (idiom); fig. deeply moving/happy and sad/inspiring and tragic
(of one's name, reputation etc) to be immortalized (idiom)/to leave a mark for generations to come
lit. golden boys and jade maidens (idiom)/attendants of the Daoist immortals/fig. lovely young children/a golden couple/(of a couple who are in the public eye) a lovely young couple
for all eternity/throughout all ages/eternity (used in an elegiac couplet, wreath etc dedicated to the dead)
anecdote/lost or apocryphal story about famous person
